page.title: 10BRISTOL AVON GORGE CLIMBING
page.content: One day in summer I climbed up the Avon Gorge.It took two hours to finish the climb.I climbed up with an expert called Allen.We started off with a rope going through my belt.Then we started to climb.Allen went up first,and put little pegs into the cracks in the rock,I then climbed up and took out the pegs.If Allen fell, all I could do was to hold the rope and hope the pegs would'nt snap.It was not an easy climb and the rock was very slippery.The last part was the most difficult and the longest.The rock was vertical and there was not big enough cracks to insert the pegs, but we made it. Written by Nicholas Bloor Age 11
